Yanbaru.name: Cape Hedo
Yanbaru.desc: The northernmost cape on Okinawa's main island, located within Yanbaru National Park.

Yanbaru.name: Nagahama Coast
Yanbaru.desc: Nagahama Beach is not a complete beach facility or swimming area, so please be aware.

Yanbaru.name: ASMUI Spiritual Hikes
Yanbaru.desc: A guided hiking experience in Okinawa that combines nature exploration with mindfulness and spiritual reflection.

Yanbaru.name: JUNGLE SUP OGIMI
Yanbaru.desc: A stand-up paddleboarding adventure through Ogimi’s lush jungle rivers, offering a unique way to experience Okinawa’s natural beauty.

Yanbaru.name: TarzanWorld
Yanbaru.desc: An outdoor adventure park offering jungle tours and night safaris to explore the wildlife and nature of northern Okinawa.

Yanbaru.name: Ta-taki Waterfall
Yanbaru.desc: A scenic waterfall in Okinawa’s jungle where visitors can enjoy hiking, swimming, and experiencing the island’s natural beauty up close.

Yanbaru.name: Ogimi Village Bashofu Hall
Yanbaru.desc: A museum and workshop dedicated to bashofu, a traditional Okinawan fabric made from banana plant fibers.

Yanbaru.name: Oku Yanbaru No Sato
Yanbaru.desc: At the northern tip of Okinawa's main island, stands this Okinawan-style cottage.

Yanbaru.name: かっかぁカフェ
Yanbaru.desc: Kakkaa Café, a traditional-style café nestled in the Hedo village, is a special place where you can feel the nature and traditions of Okinawa.

Yanbaru.name: Yuiyui Kunigami (Michi no Eki)
Yanbaru.desc: A large roadside market offering Yanbaru pork, Ryukyu sweets, handmade crafts, and even Okinawan coffee.

Motobu.name: Nakijin Castle Ruins
Motobu.desc: Castle ruins located on the Motobu Peninsula in the northern part of Okinawa's main island.

Motobu.name: Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium
Motobu.desc: A popular tourist spot located within Okinawa's Ocean Expo Park.

Motobu.name: Nago Pineapple Parkt
Motobu.desc: You can learn about the history of pineapples in Okinawa through lectures and materials about pineapples.

Motobu.name: Junglia Okinawa
Motobu.desc: This is a large theme park that combines nature and adventure and opened in northern Okinawa.

Motobu.name: Kouri Beach
Motobu.desc: Kouri Island is a remote island belonging to Nakijin Village in Okinawa Prefecture.

Motobu.name: Ufuya
Motobu.desc: This restaurant spot emphasizes atmosphere, combining historical architecture with Okinawan cuisine and nature experiences.

Motobu.name: 潜癮沖縄 Dive Addicts Okinawa & Yellow Submarine
Motobu.desc: A professional dive center in Okinawa providing fun dives, training courses, and ocean adventures for beginners and experienced divers alike.

Motobu.name: 備瀬の宿 結 Lagoon&Coral
Motobu.desc: A cozy guesthouse in Bise offering ocean-view stays surrounded by Okinawa’s coral reefs and peaceful village scenery.

Motobu.name: RYUKYU BREEZE
Motobu.desc: A premium villa-stay in Nago with a private pool, just steps from a natural beach, ideal for a luxurious and tranquil Okinawa getaway.

Motobu.name: Motobu Town Market
Motobu.desc: A traditional market with small shops selling fresh seafood, vegetables, traditional snacks, handmade crafts, and souvenirs.

Motobu.name: Orion Happy Park
Motobu.desc: After the tour, you can buy Orion beer, limited-edition souvenirs, original glasses, T-shirts, and snacks.

Central Okinawa.name: American Village
Central Okinawa.desc: The street is lined with stores modeled after American townscapes.

Central Okinawa.name: Katsuren Castle Ruins
Central Okinawa.desc: The ruins of a castle built on a hill on the Katsuren Peninsula in the central part of Okinawa's main island.

Central Okinawa.name: Southeast Botanical Gardens
Central Okinawa.desc: This is a comprehensive facility where you can not only enjoy viewing plants, but also interact with animals and take part in seasonal events.

Central Okinawa.name: Ryukyu Village
Central Okinawa.desc: Popular programs include those that allow you to experience Okinawan culture, such as dressing in Ryukyuan clothing.

Central Okinawa.name: Manza Park
Central Okinawa.desc: A scenic spot that represents Okinawa.

Central Okinawa.name: Tropical Beach
Central Okinawa.desc: The white sandy beach and clear blue sea make for a beautiful view.

Central Okinawa.name: Hamaya
Central Okinawa.desc: This is a famous restaurant that Okinawa soba fans should definitely check out.

Central Okinawa.name: Tsurukamedo Zenzai
Central Okinawa.desc: If you want to eat zenzai in Okinawa, this is one of the famous restaurants you should definitely visit.

Central Okinawa.name: Sunkissed Divers Okinawa-Yomitan
Central Okinawa.desc: A friendly dive shop in Yomitan offering personalized scuba diving and snorkeling experiences for all skill levels in Okinawa’s crystal-clear waters.

Central Okinawa.name: Mt. Ishikawa Adventure Rope Trail
Central Okinawa.desc: A small yet scenic 204 m mountain with tropical forest trails and coastal views, perfect for an easy 1–2 hour hike beyond the beaches.

Central Okinawa.name: The Stella Hamahiga
Central Okinawa.desc: A seaside hotel on Hamahiga Island offering peaceful ocean views and a relaxing Okinawan island atmosphere.

Central Okinawa.name: サンライン北谷コンドミニアムリゾート
Central Okinawa.desc: A modern resort in Chatan’s lively Mihama district, offering spacious apartment-style rooms with kitchens and laundry, just steps away from shopping, dining and sunset beaches.

South Okinawa.name: Kokusai Dori
South Okinawa.desc: Located in the center of Naha City, this is Okinawa's main street

South Okinawa.name: Outlet Mall Ashibinaa
South Okinawa.desc: Okinawa Prefecture's first outlet mall is located close to the beach at Toyosaki Seaside Park.

South Okinawa.name: Tsuboya Yachimun Street
South Okinawa.desc: Yachimun is a type of pottery unique to Okinawa that has a history of over 300 years, dating back to the Ryukyu Dynasty.

South Okinawa.name: Shurijo Castle
South Okinawa.desc: Shuri Castle is the only red castle in Japan, painted in a vibrant vermilion color.

South Okinawa.name: Tamaudun
South Okinawa.desc: This mausoleum was built during the reign of King Sho Shin, famous for the heyday of the Ryukyu Kingdom.

South Okinawa.name: Okinawa World
South Okinawa.desc: This is a spot where you can experience Okinawa's unique nature, culture, and traditional crafts all in one place.

South Okinawa.name: Naminoue Shrine
South Okinawa.desc: An ancient shrine built on a cliff jutting out into the blue sea.

South Okinawa.name: Valley of Gangala
South Okinawa.desc: Located in the southern part of Okinawa's main island, this valley was created when a limestone cave collapsed hundreds of thousands of years ago.

South Okinawa.name: Naminoue Beach
South Okinawa.desc: This is the only beach within Naha city limits. It is a highly convenient beach, close to the city center, airport, Kokusai Street, and more.

South Okinawa.name: Okinawa soba EIBUN
South Okinawa.desc: There are a wide variety of combinations of noodles, soups and toppings.

South Okinawa.name: RiShimaDive
South Okinawa.desc: A diving company in Okinawa offering guided scuba and snorkeling tours to explore the island’s vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

South Okinawa.name: CABIN & HOTEL ReTIME
South Okinawa.desc: A modern cabin-style hotel in Naha offering capsule and cabin rooms, a large communal bath and private saunas, all just a five-minute walk from Asahibashi Station.

South Okinawa.name: Okinawa Harbor View Hotel
South Okinawa.desc: A distinguished city-resort hotel in Naha blending Okinawan tradition with international service, located in a convenient central area for exploring the city.

South Okinawa.name: 鮮魚 ふくむら
South Okinawa.desc: A hidden seafood restaurant in Naha known for its fresh sashimi, generous set meals and strong local flavour.

South Okinawa.name: Shikina-en Royal Gardens 識名園
South Okinawa.desc: A beautifully restored late-18th-century Ryukyu-royal garden in Naha featuring Chinese-Japanese styled bridges, a central pond and subtropical woodland, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

South Okinawa.name: パーラー波の上
South Okinawa.desc: A cozy café in Naha’s Wakasa district, just a short walk from Naminoue Beach, offering delicious pizzas and a relaxed beach-side atmosphere.
